Variables

Now we have hardcoded the string we are printing to the screen. What if we wanted to greet the player with the day of the week. We would need to dynamically change the text during the game to display what day it is. What we do is we store the information in a variable.

A variable is like a box that contains data. The variable is the address of the box so that the computer knows where the information is stored. In the below example the variable references the memory that the string holds the letters "Hello World!".

Now we will add a variable to this game object. Open obj_hello_world_text and press Variable Definitions button. Press the Add button. Change the type to String. Then we change the variable name to text and the Default value to Hello World!.

Go back to the Draw Event in obj_hello_world_text and replace the string text with the variable name text.

Now run the game by pressing the Play Button in the top menu bar to launch the game. You will see that it doesn't show the word text the name of the variable, but instead the value that is inside it Hello World!

Now you can also have multiple copies of a single object in the Room/Level. Each copy is referred to as an instance. Each instance can have a different value for the text variable. To change this single instance open the room by double left clicking on rm_hello_world then double left clicking on the game object in the middle of the room. Then press the Variables button and it brings out another fly out window. Press the Pencil icon to edit the Value.

Type in something new like Hello Marco! (you can substitue Marco with your name if you prefer). This will make the change for this single object. If you remove this (by pressing the minus icon where the pencil used to be) it will go back to its original default value of Hello World!.

Now to show you that you can have the same object with different variable values for each instance lets drag another obj_hello_world_text into the room under the previous one:

Repeat the above process of double clicking on this new instance and change its default Value to Nice to see you again...

Now run the game by pressing the Play Button in the top menu bar to launch the game. Now you have the same game object with different values for the text variable that you set.
